questions.question: What does 'HTML' stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML stands for Hypertext Markup Language, used for creating web pages

questions.question: Which data structure follows LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle?
questions.explanation: Stack follows LIFO principle where the last element added is the first one to be removed

questions.question: What does 'IP' stand for in networking?
questions.explanation: IP stands for Internet Protocol, a set of rules for routing and addressing data packets

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an operating system?
questions.explanation: Microsoft Word is an application software, not an operating system. Windows, Linux, and MacOS are all operating systems

questions.question: Which programming language is primarily used for web development on the client side?
questions.explanation: JavaScript is the primary programming language for client-side web development, running in web browsers

questions.question: Which SQL command is used to retrieve data from a database?
questions.explanation: SELECT command is used to query and retrieve data from database tables

questions.question: Which OOP principle allows a class to inherit properties from another class?
questions.explanation: Inheritance allows a child class to inherit properties and methods from a parent class

questions.question: What is the time complexity of binary search in a sorted array?
questions.explanation: Binary search divides the search space in half with each comparison, resulting in O(log n) time complexity

questions.question: Which software development methodology emphasizes iterative development and customer collaboration?
questions.explanation: Agile methodology emphasizes iterative development, customer collaboration, and responding to change

questions.question: What does JSON stand for?
questions.explanation: JSON stands for JavaScript Object Notation, a lightweight data interchange format[2]

questions.question: Which Git command is used to create a new branch?
questions.explanation: The 'git branch <name>' command creates a new branch in Git version control system

questions.question: What type of attack involves overwhelming a server with requests?
questions.explanation: DDoS (Distributed Denial of Service) attack involves overwhelming a server with a flood of requests to make it unavailable

questions.question: Which sorting algorithm has the best average-case time complexity?
questions.explanation: Merge Sort has consistent O(n log n) time complexity in all cases, while Quick Sort has O(n²) worst case

questions.question: In a distributed system, what does CAP theorem state?
options: You can have Consistency, Availability, and Partition tolerance
You can only guarantee 2 out of 3: Consistency, Availability, Partition tolerance
Consistency is more important than Availability
questions.correct_answer: You can only guarantee 2 out of 3: Consistency, Availability, Partition tolerance
questions.explanation: CAP theorem states that in a distributed system, you cannot simultaneously guarantee all three: Consistency, Availability, and Partition tolerance

questions.question: What is the space complexity of a hash table?
questions.explanation: Hash table space complexity is O(n) where n is the number of key-value pairs stored

questions.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for classification problems?
questions.explanation: Support Vector Machine (SVM) is a supervised learning algorithm commonly used for classification tasks

questions.question: What is the main difference between IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS?
questions.explanation: IaaS (Infrastructure), PaaS (Platform), and SaaS (Software) represent different levels of service abstraction in cloud computing

questions.question: What is the time complexity of finding the Longest Common Subsequence using dynamic programming?
questions.explanation: The dynamic programming solution for LCS has time complexity O(m×n) where m and n are lengths of the two sequences, typically simplified to O(n²)

questions.question: In microservices architecture, what pattern is used to handle distributed transactions?
questions.explanation: Saga Pattern is used in microservices to handle distributed transactions by breaking them into a series of local transactions

questions.question: What is the worst-case time complexity of the Traveling Salesman Problem using brute force?
questions.explanation: The brute force approach to TSP checks all possible permutations of cities, resulting in O(n!) time complexity
